doc.title: Admissible Evidence
doc.plot: ADMISSIBLE EVIDENCE investigates Nazi war crimes committed between 1938 and 1945. It adopts a composite range of new technologies to forensically investigate capital offenses committed by the 'Einsatzgruppen', SS troops, and German police and auxiliaries, and the Wehrmacht against prisoners of wars and civilians - including Jews, gypsies, Communists, homosexuals, and psychiatric patients, mainly in Central Europe and the Soviet Union, and in keeping with its respect of international law, not actions against partisan guerrillas. The same advanced technologies will be used to identify and honor their victims.
